Getting Started With Microservices and Go

November 07, 2016

Reading time ~1 minute

Traditionally applications have been built as monoliths; single applications which become larger and more complex over time, which limit our ability to react to change. Go is expressive, concise, clean, and efficient. Its concurrency mechanisms make it easy to write programs that get the most out of multicore and networked machines, while its novel type system enables flexible and modular program construction. Go compiles quickly to machine code yet has the convenience of garbage collection and the power of run-time reflection. Itâ€™s a fast, statically typed, compiled language that feels like a dynamically typed, interpreted language.

go golang microservices architecture programming
